results.title: Screen Worlds opening : September 2009
results.brief_description:
On Thursday September 17, 2009 ACMI’s new permanent screen culture exhibition Screen Worlds, was officially launched. The red carpet, VIP event attracted world wide attention with the attendance of both internationally recognised and home grown guests and artists. Kicking off the formalities was ACMI’s Board President, John Thwaites, followed by ACMI Director Tony Sweeney, Oscar® Winning Actress Cate Blanchett, Victorian Arts Minister Lynne Kosky and Victorian Premier John Brumby.
Following this, the ribbon is cut and guests enter the exhibition for the first time.

results.title: Rollergirl
results.brief_description: This performance art film features bluescreen technology with the director/actor rollerskating to background images of war, weapons and military might. No dialogue - music soundtrack.

results.title: Night cries: a rural tragedy
results.brief_description: In Tracey Moffatt’s re-imaging of the pivotal Australian film “Jedda”, a middle-aged Aboriginal woman returns to her outback home to nurse her dying white mother. Filmed against lushly coloured sets that recall the technicolour glories of the past, and utilising a harsh discordant soundscape, “Night Cries” occupies the landscape of dreams and the classic mythic terrain of familial violence and betrayal. This short film does more than simply reconfigure and re-imagine past narratives. It inaugurated a clear and permament break with previous moving image representations of the “outback”: no longer the pretence that it is a place outside language and history.

results.title: The Adventures of Floss the Fairy and Riddley Robot: the letter Z runs away
results.brief_description: Written and produced by an Early Childhood teacher in Queensland, this tape is aimed at assisting young children in developing literacy and numeracy skills. The video is interactive, allowing young children to discover and learn through literacy and numeracy experiences, and the fantasy story encompasses songs that are supported by 3D visual effects, thus creating a fun learning environment that further develops confidence and success. Areas covered include; spatial and positional word vocabulary and relationships, numbers, the alphabet, fine motor movements, self esteem, music and movement. ‘The Adventures of Floss the Fairy and Riddley Robot’ will entertain and educate children aged 7 months to 7 years.

results.title: In the beginning
results.brief_description: A colourful clay animation film which satirizes society and its impulse to invent nuclear weapons which cause self-destruction. Looks at the invention of destructive weapons from raspberries to rockets! Narration: Brian Woods. Animation: Mark D’Arcy-Irvine, Masfufah Sani. Suitable for lower secondary level.

results.title: Solidarity with Sanna
results.brief_description: Finnish Prime Minister Sanna Marin has faced intense media scrutiny and criticism from political opponents since footage of her dancing with friends was leaked on social media. In defiance of the fuss, women in Finland have been sharing videos of themselves partying in solidarity, creating a viral groundswell of support for the world’s youngest head of state. Marin has defended herself publicly against speculation that dancing and drinking in private undermines her professional position. The positive response and support on Twitter and TikTok has effectively turned a negative social media experience – having the video leaked – into one of empowerment.
results.description:
This video features in a responsive display in the museum that presents the moments, stories and memes capturing the zeitgeist by going viral on the internet.

Finnish Prime Minister Sanna Marin has faced intense media scrutiny and criticism from political opponents since footage of her dancing with friends was leaked on social media. In defiance of the fuss, women in Finland have been sharing videos of themselves partying in solidarity, creating a viral groundswell of support for the world’s youngest head of state. Marin has defended herself publicly against speculation that dancing and drinking in private undermines her professional position. The positive response and support on Twitter and TikTok has effectively turned a negative social media experience – having the video leaked – into one of empowerment.

In defiance of the fuss, women in Finland have been sharing videos of themselves partying in solidarity, creating a viral groundswell of support for the world’s youngest head of state. Marin has defended herself publicly against speculation that dancing and drinking in private undermines her professional position. The positive response and support on Twitter and TikTok has effectively turned a negative social media experience – having the video leaked – into one of empowerment.

results.title: Hyper >> [games magazine] Issue 100, February 2002
results.brief_description:
Hyper was a multi-platform Australian video game magazine. It was Australia’s longest running gaming magazine, published from 1993 to 2019.

In addition to coverage of current major video game systems and game releases, Hyper also covered anime, DVD movies, arcade and classic games, and featured interviews with industry professionals and articles on game-related content such as game classifications, computer hardware and video game music. Hyper also had a sister magazine, the PC gaming oriented PC PowerPlay. (citation from Wikipedia).

A digital version of the magazine can be found here: https://archive.org/details/hyper-100
